properties.name: captureBindParameters
properties.label: Bind parameters
description: Capture jdbc bind parameters for PreparedStatement executions. This is disabled by
default as it can cause Glowroot to capture potentially secure data, e.g. account
data being stored to an account table.

properties.name: captureResultSetNavigate
properties.label: ResultSet navigation
properties.checkboxLabel: Capture timing metrics for ResultSet navigation
description: Capture timing metrics for executions of ResultSet.next()/previous()/relative()/etc
to read the next record in a result set. This defaults to true since the timing for
this metric is a good indication of jdbc fetch size issues and database latency,
but it can be disabled if it is common to return millions of records and the overhead
of System.nanoTime() becomes relevant.

properties.name: captureResultSetGet
properties.label: ResultSet values
properties.checkboxLabel: Capture timing metrics for ResultSet value retrieval
description: Capture timing metrics for executions of ResultSet.get*() to read the individual column
values out of a result set record. This defaults to false since the number of calls can
be excessive and generally ResultSet.next() captures more interesting info with less
overhead.

properties.name: capturePreparedStatementCreation
properties.label: Prepared statement creation
description: Capture timing metrics for executions of Connection.prepareStatement() and
Connection.prepareCall().

properties.name: captureStatementClose
properties.label: Statement close
description: Capture timing metrics for executions of Statement.close().

properties.name: captureTransactionLifecycleTraceEntries
properties.label: Transaction lifecycle
properties.description: Capture trace entries for executions of Connection.setAutoCommit()

properties.name: captureConnectionLifecycleTraceEntries
properties.label: Connection lifecycle
properties.checkboxLabel: Capture trace entries for Connection opening and closing
description: Capture trace entries for executions of DataSource.getConnection()
and Connection.close()

properties.name: stackTraceThresholdMillis
properties.label: Stack trace threshold (millis)
description: Any jdbc call that exceeds this threshold will have a stack trace captured and attached
to it. An empty value will not collect any stack traces, a zero value will collect a
stack trace for every jdbc call.
